description: Advanced senior-level chemistry focusing on organic chemistry, reaction mechanisms, functional groups, analytical techniques, polymers, electrochemistry, thermodynamics, acid-base equilibria, kinetics, coordination chemistry, and nuclear chemistry. Designed to prepare students for university-level chemistry and AP/IB courses.

topics.name: Unit 1: Foundations of Organic Chemistry
topics.description: Introduction to organic molecules, hybridization, nomenclature, isomerism, functional groups, and basic reaction types.

topics.name: Unit 2: Alkanes and Cycloalkanes
topics.description: Structure, nomenclature, conformations, physical properties, and free radical reactions of alkanes and cycloalkanes.

topics.name: Unit 3: Alkenes and Alkynes
topics.description: Structure, nomenclature, addition reactions, stereochemistry, polymerization, and reaction mechanisms of unsaturated hydrocarbons.

topics.name: Unit 4: Haloalkanes & Reaction Mechanisms
topics.description: Substitution and elimination reactions, nucleophiles, leaving groups, reaction kinetics, and mechanism analysis.

topics.name: Unit 5: Alcohols, Ethers & Phenols
topics.description: Structure, properties, nomenclature, preparation methods, reactions, and acidity/basicity of alcohols, ethers, and phenols.

topics.name: Unit 6: Aldehydes & Ketones
topics.description: Nomenclature, structure, nucleophilic addition reactions, oxidation/reduction, and reaction mechanisms.

topics.name: Unit 7: Carboxylic Acids & Derivatives
topics.description: Acid strength, derivatives (esters, amides, acid chlorides), nucleophilic acyl substitution, and reaction pathways.

topics.name: Unit 8: Analytical Techniques & Polymers
topics.description: Spectroscopy (IR, NMR, MS), chromatography methods, polymerization, and polymer properties.

topics.name: Unit 9: Electrochemistry
topics.description: Redox reactions, galvanic and electrolytic cells, electrode potentials, and electrochemical calculations.

topics.name: Unit 10: Chemical Thermodynamics
topics.description: First and second laws of thermodynamics, enthalpy, entropy, Gibbs free energy, and spontaneity of reactions.

topics.name: Unit 11: Acid-Base Equilibria
topics.description: Strong and weak acids/bases, buffer solutions, titration curves, Ka/Kb calculations, and solubility equilibria.

topics.name: Unit 12: Advanced Kinetics & Coordination
topics.description: Reaction rates, rate laws, mechanism studies, catalysis, and coordination chemistry including ligands and complex ions.

topics.name: Unit 13: Nuclear Chemistry & Review
topics.description: Radioactivity, nuclear reactions, half-life calculations, fission and fusion, and comprehensive review of chemistry concepts.
